oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The tip of the tongue of the Springbok is not eaten by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-25. 6025-6030).
When the springbok's tongue-tip is eaten, the person stumbles over a stone and stubs his or her toe.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eating the springbok's tongue
tip
